title: mRemoteNG Chocolatey Package
author: jcefoli
body_snippet:
Feature request for a Chocolatey package, so anyone can install this from the Chocolatey package manager. I've never created a Chocolatey package before, but wouldn't mind looking into it or maintaining it, since I follow these releases.

Since an MSI installer is generated, it shouldn't be too difficult.

iterations.description: Chocolatey/winget packaging is a distribution/infrastructure task, not a code change — out of scope for our fork's development roadmap

As this thing mentioned above is already some years old I looked up again on how Chocolatey works. There is the discussed "Chocolatey downloads software directly from source" and the "self contained way", where the installer is located on chocolatey's servers. As mRemoteNG is licensed with GNU GPL v2 it shouldn't be an issue to create a "self contained" package.

comments.author: jcefoli
comments.snippet:
I still vote that this gets investigated and we look into adding it to Chocolatey and maybe even the winget package manager.

Github does not care if you link to their binaries. I checked with them a while back, specifically mentioning Chocolatey and ther was no issue. It's something that could be added to the CI to automatically publish these packages when a new release happens.
